newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss sight deposits rise to 3,192.7 million Sfr.
newsitem.headline: Swiss sight deposits rise to 3,192.7 million Sfr.

text.p: The Swiss National Bank said sight deposits rose by 98.8 million Swiss francs 3.19 billion in the reporting period ended October 18.
Statement of October 18 in millions of Swiss francs:
Borrowing at the emergency Lombard window rose by 1.7 million francs to 1.7 million in the reporting period.
Outstanding borrowing via the discount facility and swaps of money market certificates fell by 119.2 million francs to 1,314.0 million.
The relatively high level of sight deposits reflected the continued flexibility of the central bank, an SNB spokesman said.
He said the low level of Lombard borrowings also illustrated the relaxed situation in the money market. -- Zurich Editorial +41 1 631 7340
